messages.subject: Re: making chalk
messages.msgSnippet: ... I ve heard that Kool-Aide is a good alternative. I ve got a knitting book where the yarn was dyed using it, and it looks great. E.
messages.messageBody:
> Yesterday we made chalk using plaster of paris and food colouring. It's
> worked well but we used an amazing amount of food colouring and I'm
> wondering whether tempera paint would work just as well or better. Has
> anyone tried it?
>
> Julie, who has rainbow coloured fingers

I've heard that Kool-Aide is a good alternative. I've got a knitting
book where the yarn was dyed using it, and it looks great.

E.

messages.subject: making chalk
messages.msgSnippet: Yesterday we made chalk using plaster of paris and food colouring. It s worked well but we used an amazing amount of food colouring and I m wondering whether
messages.messageBody:
Yesterday we made chalk using plaster of paris and food colouring. It's
worked well but we used an amazing amount of food colouring and I'm
wondering whether tempera paint would work just as well or better. Has
anyone tried it?

Julie, who has rainbow coloured fingers
